Brazilian jiu jitsu has changed my life- in so many ways- it has made me physically stronger and more flexible than at any other point in my life- I am 42 years old and I have never felt better- the benefits go way beyond the physical- it is like a meditation for me- the lessons have been so valuable in other parts of my life- learning to persevere, to become comfortable with being uncomfortable, to never give up hope, to understand that you only need a millimeter of space to completely change a situation, learning to be able to lose without being beaten, learning to win without causing pain... and to remain humble no matter what... I am so grateful for jiu jitsu- and for my brothers and sisters on the mats, people from all walks of life placing a huge amount of trust in each other every minute on the mat- pushing each other to be better versions of themselves- practicing jiu jitsu is unlike anything else I have ever done- there is nowhere to hide on the mat so your only choice is to grow and evolve. If you are lost- jiu jitsu will find you. If you have children- give them the gift of jiu jitsu so they never ever feel like victims. I am lucky enough to train at @rogergracieacademy with the best teachers and training partners in the world in what I think is a golden age of jiu jitsu right now. I'm able to train with and learn from @rogergracie @charlesnegromonte @h_juniao @mgomes55 @brunozancaner ... it's difficult to put that in to context... if you know jiu jitsu then you know.... This is an image from the recent British Championships- my opponent was a tough competitor- I managed to secure a choke that put him to sleep- he came to completely unharmed and we spent the rest of the afternoon chatting like old friends... that's jiu jitsu.... it's not tennis but it's fun all the same. @jiu_jitsu_brotherhood @bjjstyle

This is such an easy way to make a profound and wonderful change in the world- use fully biodegradable straws! Bob knew some things.
When my father died, his only possession was an old guitar- I looked right thru the house but there just wasn't anything that really belonged to him, he just didn't care about 'things'... He loved people.. And he was the happiest person I've known. He was kind and gentle and humble. At his funeral, the church was completely full. The priest said it was the first time he had ever seen it like that. We had no idea how many people loved my dad- from all walks of life- because he lived without judgement. Tough tattooed men shed tears alongside nuns and school children.
I try hard every day to live up to the lessons I learnt from the way dad lived his life and try to pass on something of him to my children.
Anyway- thanks Bob for saying this so beautifully.

|| OH NOOO! ||
This is an old video but it's relevant today- someone called 'Dr Max the mind doctor' has written an article today saying that 'clean eating' isn't a fad- it's an eating disorder- I wish I could disagree- it has been hijacked by ruthless bloggers and insta-experts who are ruining people's bodies and minds... but here's the thing- Max Pemberton (mind Doctor) very strangely said that sugar isn't the problem it's made out to be- and that our bodies need glucose for energy... which it does- I get the same statements from 22 year old vegan insta-experts- this position is dangerously reductive- the amount of sugar consumed in the western world is an absolute disaster for our health- it is an horrific situation and it needs to be addressed- if you know Dr Max please put us in touch- I'd love to understand more... also- not everyone has an issue with gluten- but most of what gluten is in- isn't good for you.. in saying that- just because something says 'gluten free' doesn't mean it's good for you- it may be packed full of sugars (pretend sugars as well) that will damage your health. So... don't trust the experts! I'm supposed to be one and I don't know you as well as you do! Question everything! Keep it simple and Trust yourself! Please be careful of the wellness bloggers! most of all- be kind to yourself. If you like this video please feel free to share it or tag people in it.. if you don't like it- keep it to yourself- my self esteem can't take it. But seriously- it's a jungle out there- go be the king of the jungle!

I love this one... Everywhere you look lately you'd be forgiven for thinking Christmas is only about giving presents. Actually, the best thing you can give is your presence.
This dawned on me recently when thinking about my father, Kevin. To me he was a super hero. I always tried to look and sound like him (note my T-shirt tucked into my jeans in the snap below; my son Leo still prefers his starry top to my old man sweater). This February it will be four years since he passed away. Looking back, I remember when we had to figure out what to do with his belongings, we were surprised to find he really didn't have any. He died with barely a material possession to his name, and yet, he was the happiest person I’ve ever known.

It made me realise that no thing will make you happy.

He wasn't attached to ‘stuff’. His self worth wasn’t tied up in what kind of watch he had or whether his jeans were the right cut. It was tied up in the time he had with us, his family, his friends.

Obviously he was my hero but everyone loved my dad. He was a cool cat. He didn’t care what people thought about him. He cared about people. That’s why at his funeral people were spilling out of the door to pay their respects.

Now when I think of him I realise time is the greatest gift you can give. You can’t buy it back. You can’t negotiate it back. You can’t bully it back – believe me, I’ve tried.

The very best thing you can do is be present to it, in the moment, and share it with the people you love.

So, this Christmas, what can you give someone to make them feel special and loved and cared for? It’s not a cashmere scarf or a drone or any thing. It’s no thing. It’s a phone call. Or a FaceTime. It’s your time.
You can change everything.

|| pressure ||
Most of the pressure we feel in our lives is self created. Leading up to this fight I had created an enormous amount of pressure on my self by focusing on the result rather than focussing on simply being the best version of myself. To get my head in the moment I repeated a mantra- 'trust the process' and it was only moments before this picture was taken that it all clicked and I started to move freely and feel in the 'flow' of the moment. Unfortunately I tripped over and soiled myself... only kidding- I won the fight and had a wonderful reminder of how powerful it is to trust the process and focus simply on doing your best and accepting what that brings in to your life.

I'm so proud of how the community here has come together to help- and I'm worried about the anger and despair that people are feeling... none of this should have happened... We need to make sure that what happened at Grenfell tower never happens again. We need to hold everyone that was involved in cutting corners and cutting costs, accountable- everyone- from the top down- it's not good enough to say 'I was just doing what I was told'.... anyone who knew how dangerous the tower was needs to be held accountable so that there is never a next time. We now need to care for the children who have been traumatised and left with nothing, not just for the next few weeks- but for the next months and years- they are our children now. I hope love wins. I hope people channel their anger and frustration in to a long term effort to change things. I hope this forces change. The lost lives of those innocent people need to be honoured by profound and drastic change.

|| question everything ||
This is an important one- the national osteoporosis society has just published an article saying clean eating could be dangerous because it often suggests giving up dairy... they are sponsored by Yoplait... who make yoghurt... a dairy product... this is a deeply concerning conflict (in my opinion) and it is also dangerously misleading (in my opinion)- you can get all of your calcium requirements from many other foods. This serves as a reminder to question everything- listen to your body- and most importantly be kind to yourself. Please please share this and tag anyone who will either benefit from hearing this message or who will help to share it. I hope and pray that we get clean eating back from the ruthless bloggers who have hijacked it and turned it in to a restrictive, obsessive fad- and bring it back to its truth- which is a simple healthy way of life- eating food in its natural state, that is as unprocessed and fresh- as often as possible.
Now here's the thing on dairy- if you have an issue with it- either moral or physical- then you have an abundance of other options- if you don't have an issue with dairy... then enjoy dairy... but please do think of those cows with their big beautiful brown eyes that aren't having a very nice time...
Thanks for listening.

Breakfast Inspiration!!! Cacao, carob and coconut granola! Cacao is the real deal – the untouched purest form of chocolate without all the sugary rubbish – and it is a great source of health-boosting antioxidants. Carob contains as much vitamin B1 as asparagus or strawberries and is packed with calcium, and coconut is a fantastic source of good fat, which helps you metabolise bad fat.

SERVES 4-6
Ingredients
300g (11oz) unsweetened coconut flakes
200g (7oz) mixed nuts
50g (2oz) pumpkin seeds
30g (1¼ oz) sunflower seeds
30g (1¼ oz) cacao nibs
3 tablespoons chia seeds
1 tablespoon raw cacao powder
1 teaspoon carob powder
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
3 tablespoons maple syrup
4 tablespoons coconut oil melted Method

1 Preheat the oven to 150C/gas 2. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper and set aside. Put all the dry ingredients into a large bowl and mix to combine. Once thoroughly mixed, stir in the wet ingredients.

2 Lay the granola out evenly on the baking trays, spreading out well and trying not to leave any ingredients on top of each other.

3 Bake for 10-15 minutes, or until golden brown, then remove from the oven and leave to cool completely before storing in an airtight jar for up to 2 weeks. (Some oil may sink to the bottom of the jar.) Taken from Clean and Lean For Life: my new book- but it at bodyism.com right now!

|| question everything ||
A young blogger in Australia was recently in serious legal trouble- she had a successful blog and Instagram account called healing belle- she lied about having cancer and kept money that she had promised to give to charities- its a sad story all around- she's not the last young blogger who will end up in serious trouble- and many more people will end up getting hurt... so what can we do to protect ourselves from the craziness and danger? In a gluten free nut shell- keep it simple, remember that if it sounds crazy or feels wrong.. it is... if it's a fad... it won't work... if you're counting calories- it won't work.. please know this- you are the expert on you- trust yourself and tune in and most of all... BE KIND TO YOUR SELF
Oh- don't listen to any organisation that is sponsored by a major food company (do your research), don't buy wellness products from someone who spends more money on Botox, fillers and hair extensions than most people spend on a house... and don't listen to anyone who tells you to eat thirty bananas a day (yes this is a thing)
Value yourself please- you're incredible and we need you happy and healthy.

it's almost two years since my dad died and every now and then I still struggle with accepting it... So, about a year ago I was asking if he could hear me and praying for a little sign, this appeared in the clouds, to me it looks like a heart and it makes me feel better every time I see it. I took a photo so I could always remind myself that there is maybe something more to this world and our lives... I could be wrong but believing that my dad is still with me in some way helps me get thru the tough days. If you're struggling with sadness or loss today- please know that you're not alone... And that like these clouds, the sadness passes.

Imagine if you could do anything you set your mind to? Imagine if you were capable of things you haven’t even dreamt of? Imagine if you were more powerful than all of your excuses?

The truth is you are. Take this opportunity right now, to set yourself free from all of your limiting beliefs, from any fear, doubt or shame and guilt you have been carrying around unnecessarily for so long now.

Remember that your past does not equal your future and that whatever has happened in the past is there for you to learn from. Understand there is no such thing as failure, only feedback.

Forgive yourself for everything: for things you’ve said, the things you’ve done, your perceived failures, for the times when you’ve fallen short of your expectations and other people’s expectations… all of it. Because none of that matters now.

If what you’re doing hasn’t worked or isn’t working then embrace the power of now and change your behaviours, your beliefs, your words, your thoughts and your actions until you get the results you need. Take a moment also to celebrate and enjoy your successes - the small moments of kindness and happiness you have brought into someone else’s life. The times that you have been grateful, the times you have been of service, the times that you have faced a fear and gone through with it anyway; those are the things that matter. And so do you, you matter.

What matters right now is that you accept yourself as you are. Perfect, whole and complete. Pour love in everything you do today and for the rest this year and the rest of your life.

Be fearless in your pursuit of kindness, love and gratitude and begin to live the life of your dreams, the life you truly deserve. A life full of love, happiness, joy, health, success and… Bodyism pancakes! Choose to be Unstoppable - I’m here and so are the rest of the Bodyism team to help you.
Thank you so so much and as always- please remember to be kind to yourself.

|| CONFUSED? || The recent controversy on clean eating has left a lot of people confused- and angry- so just remember this- you are the expert, listen to your body, keep it simple, question everything and most of all... be kind to yourself.
People have made a fortune in the wellness industry by turning clean eating (a life changing philosophy that I'm so proud to be a part of with the clean and lean diet books) in to a confusing, restrictive obsession. Please be careful of people on social media being irresponsible and completely unaccountable for the things they say and the way in which they present physical, emotional and mental health (it doesn't involve posting endless pictures of your butt in bikini bottoms- no matter how 'spiritual' or 'empowering' they try to make it sound). If it sounds crazy- it is crazy- if it makes you miserable- it's not working... please be kind to yourself and choose foods, thoughts, words and actions that elevate you. Hope this helps- please share it or tag people in it if you think it is of value.

I love that Charlo gets up after falling without a hint of embarrassment or shame- no self judgement at all- I hope and pray she can live her life like this- imagine how powerful that would be- if you weren't afraid of failing- what would you do? It reaffirms how important it is to let go of shame and guilt and practice self acceptance. Thanks for being such a guru/Jedi Charlo.
